definition: China, Taiwan, Hong Kong and Macau (media term used esp. since 1997)
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: References to waterways, transport and the communication of the three geographic areas were all considered.
sentences.chinese: 名稱可讓人想到水路，運輸，兩岸三地的連接渠道等。

sentences.english: In 2001, China held the Strait three exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 2001年，舉辦中國海峽兩岸三地畫展。

sentences.english: Air Macau has been since the first flight, that is, open and convenient cross-strait cargo flights.
sentences.chinese: 澳門航空自首航以來，即開啓兩岸三地貨運便捷航線。

sentences.english: He, is Zhou Jie's human relations , one of the present most popular singers of three places of two sides.
sentences.chinese: 他，就是周杰倫，兩岸三地當前最受歡迎的歌手之一。

definition: domestic and international/at home and abroad
peak/apex/world best/number one/finest (competitors)/top (figures in a certain field)

abbr. for 國民大會|国民大会, National Assembly of the Republic of China (extant during various periods between 1913 and 2005)/abbr. for 新加坡國立大學|新加坡国立大学, National University of Singapore (NUS)/abbr. for 印度國民大會黨|印度国民大会党, Indian National Congress (INC)/abbr. for 馬來西亞印度國民大會黨|马来西亚印度国民大会党, Malaysian Indian Congress (MIC)
Asia/abbr. for 亞細亞洲|亚细亚洲[Ya4 xi4 ya4 Zhou1]
to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
to rely on/to depend on/by means of/thanks to/sth that one relies on/also written 憑借|凭借[ping2 jie4]
